metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0995 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds (OOB) memory write flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s watch_queue event notification subsystem. This flaw can overwrite parts of the kernel state, potentially allowing a local user to gain privileged access or cause a denial of service on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> multiple individual commits from the merged branch
